intro: Peucedanum latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to Central Asia and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length, and its flowers are typically white or pale green. It is often cultivated for its medicinal properties, with the roots and leaves used in traditional remedies. The plant's chemical composition includes various volatile oils and flavonoids, contributing to its therapeutic uses.
